question: What is JavaScript, and how does it differ from Java?

question: Explain the concept of variable scope in JavaScript.
options: Scope refers to the visibility of an element on a webpage.
JavaScript has only global scope.
Variable scope refers to the context in which variables are defined
Scope is irrelevant in JavaScript.

question: Explain the difference between margin and padding in CSS.
options: Margin is space inside an element; padding is space outside an element.
Margin is space outside an element; padding is space inside an element
Margin and padding are the same.
Margin and padding are used interchangeably.

question: When to use derived state in React?
options: Whenever the state should not trigger a re-render
Whenever the state can be synchronized with an effect
Whenever the state should be accessible to all components
Whenever the state can be computed from another state variable

question: Describe the difference between "block" and "inline" elements in HTML.
options: Block elements take up as much width as necessary.
Inline elements start on a new line
Block elements don't start on a new line.
Inline elements take up the full width available.

question: Describe the CSS box model and its components.
options: Defines the shape of CSS elements.
Consists of content only.
Consists of content, padding, border, and margin
Describes the layout of the webpage.

question: How does asynchronous programming work in JavaScript, and what are callbacks?
options: Asynchronous tasks are executed sequentially.
Asynchronous tasks execute in parallel; callbacks are functions passed to another function and executed after an asynchronous operation
Asynchronous programming is not supported in JavaScript
Callbacks are used for synchronous operations only

question: How can you center an element horizontally and vertically in CSS?
options: Use the "center" property.
Apply "margin: auto;" for horizontal centering
Set "vertical-align: center;"
Use the "center-align" attribute.

question: Describe the purpose of the "this" keyword in JavaScript.
options: Refers to the current element in the DOM.
"this" points to the next function in line.
"this" refers to the current execution context
"this" is a placeholder for undefined values.

question: What is the significance of the "alt" attribute in an HTML image tag?
options: Alternate image style
Image alignment
Alternative text for accessibility and if the image cannot be loaded
Altitude of the image

question: What is the difference between "class" and "id" selectors in CSS?
options: Classes can be used on multiple elements; IDs must be unique
Classes must be unique; IDs can be used on multiple elements.
Classes and IDs are interchangeable.
Classes and IDs serve the same purpose.

question: What is the difference between "undefined" and "null" in JavaScript?
options: Both represent the absence of a value.
"undefined" means a variable has been declared but not defined; "null" represents the absence of any object value
"undefined" and "null" are interchangeable.
"undefined" is used for objects; "null" is used for variables.
